item.title: Dacia add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Everybody is a genius. But if you judge a fish by its ability to climb a tree, it will live its whole life believing that it is stupid." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Dacia add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Dacia add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "I've seen you, beauty, and you belong to me now, whoever you are waiting for and if I never see you again, I thought. You belong to me and all Paris belongs to me and I belong to this notebook and this pencil." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Dacia add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
Dacia add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "We ate well and cheaply and drank well and cheaply and slept well and warm together and loved each other." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Dacia add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "The only thing that could spoil a day was people. People were always the limiters of happiness except for the very few that were as good as spring itself." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Dacia add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "And there lies the horror: the past we remember is devoid of time. Impossible to reexperience a love the way we reread a book or resee a film." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Dacia add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "If in the past people would listen to music out of love for music, nowadays it roars everywhere and all the time, "regardless whether we want to hear it", it roars from loudspeakers, in cars, in restaurants, in elevators, in the streets, in waiting rooms, in gyms, in the earpieces of Walkmans, music rewritten, reorchestrated, abridged, and stretched out, fragments of rock, of jazz, of opera, a flood of everything jumbled together so that we don't know who composed it (music become noise is anonymous), so that we can't tell beginning from end (music become noise has no form): sewage-water music in which music is dying." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Dacia add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "The Greek word for "return" is nostos. Algos means "suffering." So nostalgia is the suffering caused by an unappeased yearning to return." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Dacia add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "To die; to decide to die; that's much easier for an adolescent than for an adult. What? Doesn't death strip an adolescent of a far larger portion of future? Certainly it does, but for a young person, the future is a remote, abstract, unreal thing he doesn't really believe in." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Dacia add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "The more vast the amount of time we've left behind us, the more irresistible is the voice calling us to return to it." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Dacia add a quote by Jojo Moyes
item.description:
"Sometimes she woke up speaking his name.
Sometimes she wondered how it were possible to be so far from the sea and still feel as if she were drowning." -- Jojo Moyes
